narrative.title: 44Th Infantry Division - 1942Q3
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division deployed in North Africa during 1942Q3.
narrative.objectives: Infantry division trained for offensive and defensive operations. Deployed to North Africa as reinforcement for Eighth Army. First major action at Battle of Alam el Halfa (30 Aug - 7 Sep 1942) where division held defensive positions on Alam el Halfa Ridge against German/Italian attacks.
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal plain and rocky desert (El Alamein defensive positions)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Newly arrived division with high morale and full strength
Well-trained in UK but limited desert warfare experience upon arrival
Effective anti-tank defense (1/7th Queen's knocked out 27 German tanks with 6-pounders)

environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (El Alamein defensive positions)
